values: The Drug Target Explorer helps identify small molecules that target your gene of interest, genes that are affected by your compound, or pharmacologically similar compounds. Use this tool to explore chemical similarity networks and evaluate summarized bioactivity data from ChEMBL, DrugBank, DGIdb, and other data sources.

The Synodos for NF2 study generated a broad array of data in human and mouse cell line models of meningioma and schwannoma. The Synodos Data Explorer can be used to visualize and explore high throughput drug screens, transcriptomics, and kinomics datasets from this study.

A collaboration between Johns Hopkins and NCATS provided a comprehensive dataset representing the genomics and transcriptomics of a diverse set of plexiform neurofibroma-derived cell cultures as well as high-content drug screening of 1,912 compounds across  the same lines. The pNF Cell Browser enables examination of the results of this study including the expression of various gene signatures and the response of the cells to distinct compounds of interest.
The Johns Hopkins NF1 Biospecimen Repository

The Comprehensive Neurofibromatosis Center at Johns Hopkins serves a large volume of patients affected by NF1.  We have an IRB-approved research study for banking NF1-associated tumors including plexiform neurofibromas, MPNST, and blood fractions from patients with NF1.  This repository contains tissue and blood fractions from patients with: cutaneous neurofibroma, diffuse infiltrating neurofibroma, plexiform neurofibroma, atypical neurofibroma, and MPNST.  Banked samples are available at this resource by filing a scientific proposal.
ATCC Immortalized Human pNF Cell Lines

The 'pNF Cell Line Development' study developed and characterized a set of six patient derived immortalized plexiform neurofibroma Schwann cell lines. These cell lines are now available through ATCC. Genomic and drug screening data for these cells have also been generated and can be explored using the companion pNF Cell Browser. Important: NTAP will reimburse researchers that purchase these cells - please click "Open Tool" for reimbursement details.
